Interface_name: HTTP Server - side by using Flask in python
Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Flask-based REST API for user management with configurable behaviors for testing various API scenarios.

Class Description: FlaskAPI is a class that implements a RESTful API server using Flask. It provides endpoints for user CRUD operations and order deletion, with configurable behaviors to simulate different API response scenarios for testing purposes.

Attributes:

app: [Flask] - The Flask application instance
config: [AppConfig] - Configuration object controlling API behavior
next_user_id: [int] - Counter for generating new user IDs
last_modified: [str] - Timestamp for last modification
users: [dict] - Dictionary storing user data
deleted_orders: [set] - Set tracking deleted order IDs

Methods:

__init__: [None]() -> [None] - Initializes the Flask application and sets up routes
_setup_routes: [None]() -> [None] - Private method that defines all API endpoints
get_spec: [None]() -> [Response] - Returns OpenAPI specification
get_user: [None](user_id: int) -> [Response] - Retrieves a user by ID
list_users: [None]() -> [Response] - Lists all users
create_user: [None]() -> [Response] - Creates a new user
update_user: [None](user_id: int) -> [Response] - Updates a user by ID
delete_user: [None](user_id: int) -> [Response] - Deletes a user by ID
delete_order: [None](order_id: str) -> [Response] - Handles order deletion
check_auth: [None]() -> [None] - Middleware for authorization checking
